title: We're unable to log you in because you may be offline
body:
https://i.gyazo.com/c3879b361cc57c0ab297312818cd81a9.png
We've noticed that a good number of players have been unable to login over the past 24 hours, even though they still have a solid internet connection. It seems like this might be happening due to something redirecting your connection so that it can never reach our servers. Some players have been able to use this workaround to finally get logged in:


PC:
- Go to C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config
- Open "LeagueClientSettings.yaml" with notepad
- Find the line: gameflow-patcher-lock:
- Delete this whole line
- Save the file, restart your LoL Client - and you should be able to log in again.

MAC:
-  Start and log onto League of Legends
-  Open Finder
-  Go to Applications
-  Right-click on League of Legends
-  Select Show Package Contents
-  Open Contents
-  Open LoL
-  Open Config
-  Locate LeagueClientSettings.yaml
-  Open it with a text editor and and find gameflow-patcher-lock
-  Delete the whole line
-  Save file and restart the client

If these steps don't seem to help at all, never fear! Our tech guys have another option up their sleeve that should help, but if this other option is done incorrectly it could have some bad results. Because of that, we'd like to guide you through those steps one on one in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).

replies.body:
If your League continues to display "you may be offline", follow the steps in this link
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/36668374/how-do-i-solve-the-server-dns-address-could-not-be-found-error-on-windows-10

Hope it works for you guys :)

{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

its worked.. thank you.
can i also ask if i should change it back to the default settings after  a period of time fearing that these settings might effect other areas..?

Hi, I would like to add that many people have a modified hosts file in c:/windows/systems32/drivers/etc due to an easy connection error fix from a while back. The solution to this problem is to delete the line at the bottom of the hosts file pertaining to league of legends with notepad running in administrator mode, or just delete the hosts file (you may need to disable real-time antivirus protection while you do this).
This DID work! thanks you.
I could not find the line pertaining to league of legends so I deleted the whole thing and it worked.
This did not work.
Thank you so much for this! I was struggling for a few days and this seemed to fix it!

THIS DOES NOT WORK, and I'm still seeing this error, you guys are a multi million dollar gaming company with THE STUPIDEST ERRORS, why is this still not fixed?

anyone have an alternate method?
Worked, been having this issue for a couple days. Thanks! Keep up the good work.
Just had this issue today. And this worked to fix it! Thank you!

Just wanted to log into league today but I couldn't because this message popped up " We are unable to log you in because you may be offline". It was working fine last night and I already tried the fixes recommended, still can't log in. Please help.

This post is about 4 months old and was for a very specific issue happening at that time. For something like this, it sounds like your network is just having a hard time getting a clean signal with our login servers. Update your port forwarding and DNS settings using the steps in our [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) and let me know if that helps.

Same issue happening again. Happened a month ago and this quick fix worked, but now it isn't.

Was AFK on the game's homepage for a few hours to come back saying I was disconnected (the "Play" button grayed out). Exit the game to log back in, just to have this old message show again! This time the deleting of the code line and saving does not work. I open the file again and the code is still there and still can't log in!
Didn't work

Does this also fix an Application Error? I've been getting an error every time I launch league (for the past 3 days) and it says"The application was unable to start correctly (0xc0000005). Click OK to close the application." Then it closes and if I launch league it happens again. I've tried re-installing and repairing but nothing worked.

Edit: I tried using this method but it also failed.

That error might be more related to a permissions error. Sometimes your OS doesn't recognize certain programs, and needs to be told that it's safe. Update some of your [**permission settings**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) so let me know if that helps!
